text.title: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon

head.s: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon

p.s: It can be a daunting task , building a large , eclectic and interesting play list .
This is an entirely subjective guide to how to be happier , more elitist and more impressive , on a tiny budget , without illegal downloading .

item.s: Start with a couple favorite bands that you already like .
This is usually an option .

It 's generally best if you already like one of the historically important old indie rock bands listed below , mainly if you are going for the all-encompassing eclectic-indie kind of play list that is so very rewarding .
However , if you , right now , fit into the Warnings category , you have to start somewhere on the road to cool-geekdom ( it 's the best way to superficial popularity there is ! ) .
If you do n't already , buy at least one full album each by at least three of the bands listed below .
Make sure you actually like the bands .

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 1.jpg

item.s: Read up on the bands you 've chosen using the sources listed in Tips .
Pay attention to the movement , genre or scene the band is considered a part of , and even more attention to any given similar-artists type information .

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 2.jpg

item.s: Look up whatever related bands you can find .
This is important .
Listen to them if possible .
Start making a list of albums to buy , or just bands to look for .

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 3.jpg

item.s: Keep reading about the history of the bands !
Not the members or the dates of course , but the influences and music and genre .

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 4.jpg

item.s: Never be intimidated by bands you 've never heard of , especially not old ones .
If someone is talking to you about a band you do n't know , ask them .
Go to small venue concerts whenever possible .
Who cares if you know the band ?

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 5.jpg

item.s: Develop your own tastes .
Find your own bands .
Try to focus on a niche genre while also building your overall collection .
Jazz .
Noise rock .
Experimental .
Delta blues .
Lounge .
Soul .
Crust punk .
There are so many weird bands out there , what are you waiting for ?
No one will ever think you are cool because you listen to loud music .
Remember that metal is the most popular form of music as far as sales go .
" Just because it 's loud does n't mean it 's good .
" If you go to a noise rock concert , seriously , wear earplugs .

figure.rend: Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon Step 6.jpg

item.s: Last . fm and Pandora.com are great ways to find new music you like .
Here 's their description of themselves :
" Pandora is a music discovery service designed to help you find and enjoy music that you 'll love .
It 's powered by the Music Genome Project , the most comprehensive analysis of music ever undertaken .
Just tell us one of your favorite songs or artists and we 'll launch a streaming station to explore that part of the music universe .
If you live near one , Half Price Books is a great place to get cheap music .
They almost always have CDs for $ 2 or less .
There are many independent music distribution sites out there now where you can stock up on huge amounts of obscure mp3s for free - try sites like Amie Street , Podcomplex and Broadjam .
iTunes is an excellent way to find new music , except that it does n't have an entirely complete selection .
But the music store 's Browse feature is awesome .
Look randomly for interesting-looking bands , then double click them and see if there 's a biography .
Also , the All-Music Guide
To Rock is very nice .

It 's a little hard to build your tastes from this , but LastFM is good for seeing what people like you are listening to - particularly if you live outside the US , now that Pandora has been blocked .
If you are just listening to the bands just to look cool , people who are really into the bands will see right through your pathetic attempts .
Do n't spend too much money , as in : do n't go broke for music .
A computer
An Internet connection
A media library program , such as Media Monkey or iTunes
Songbird , a program based off of the Mozilla open-source platform , aggregates mp3 blogs and samples songs ( it 's a great way to access new and upcoming artists )
